duties_responsibilities.duty: Understand and comply with regulatory requirements for financial transactions, most specifically Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) and Customer Identification Program (CIP) as it relates to specific job functions.
Provide superior customer service as an essential Austin Bank team member.
Participate in developing a teamwork atmosphere with co-workers as part of department/branch location.
Stay abreast of company communications by reading publications, announcements, and company e-mails.
Develop personal skills and capabilities through ongoing training.
Uphold and safeguard the organization's values relating to ethics, integrity, and confidentiality both internally and externally.
Greet customers and provide superior customer service.
Process loans and interview prospective customers for loans.
Attend loan closings and answer telephone calls, providing information to callers or routing calls to the appropriate person.
Greet visitors, ascertain the nature of business, and direct visitors to appropriate persons.
Schedule appointments, compose and type correspondence, read and route incoming mail, and perform other administrative and clerical duties.
Assist in coordinating departmental activities and initiate appropriate action required to expedite task completion.
File correspondence and other records, maintain files, resolve matters of a routine nature, maintain ticklers pertaining to loans, and maintain a loan exception list.
Obtain credit reports, handle confidential and sensitive information with proper discretion, explain, promote, and/or sell bank products or services.
Prepare required reports and files as necessary, notarize documents, verify port activity and file maintenance, and cross-train in other areas to provide assistance as needed.
Report to work regularly and promptly, maintain established department and bank policies, procedures, and objectives, and quality assurance.
Enhance professional growth and development through participation in in-service meetings and current literature.
